Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a glossy yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394501) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394501)
